item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 艾伦·凯：预测未来（Predicting The Future） in the user temberature at 2022-05-19T05:35:39
item.description:
in reference to:

在一些数学和科学课程中，他们经常告诉你，最好的方法是改变问题。我认为最好的方法是改变问题陈述的背景。几年前，马文·明斯基说，“你只有通过多种方式才能理解一件事。”（You don’t understand something until you understand it more than one way.）

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 不做播客节目，我不知道自己说话有那么多毛病 in the user temberature at 2022-05-23T12:53:18
item.description:
in reference to:

我甚至建议每个人在录制之前，把一张写有“呃、那个、就是、我觉得”的字条，贴到电脑屏幕上。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 我们如何才能开发出变革性的思想工具？ in the user temberature at 2022-05-24T05:50:43
item.description:
in reference to:

Adobe 与许多其他软件公司的共同点是，他们的大部分专利都是防御性的：他们把一些想法申请专利，以便专利恶霸无法通过类似的相互起诉他们。这样与理想情况大相径庭。创新型公司很容易受到专利恶霸的攻击，这些恶霸有庞大的专利库，其中专利的权利要求广泛而模糊，也没有多少细节，不费吹灰之力。但是，一旦创新型公司投入更多来实现一个非常不错的新创意，其他公司总能复制该创新的核心，对其进行合适改变，以合理地规避任何专利侵权。专利制度没有保护应该保护的东西。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 我们如何才能开发出变革性的思想工具？ in the user temberature at 2022-05-24T05:56:52
item.description:
in reference to:

虽然硬件可以被复制，但它往往比复制软件要昂贵得多。而且不仅如此，这类公司的优势往往在于分销、营销，以及与为该平台生产产品的供应商的关系。

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 4.6. 暂退法（Dropout） — 动手学深度学习 2.0.0-beta0 documentation in the user temberature at 2022-05-26T05:59:23
item.description:
in reference to:

需要说明的是，暂退法的原始论文提到了一个关于有性繁殖的类比： 神经网络过拟合与每一层都依赖于前一层激活值相关，称这种情况为“共适应性”。 作者认为，暂退法会破坏共适应性，就像有性生殖会破坏共适应的基因一样。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 加粗几个字母之后，英语阅读速度原地起飞，真的这么神奇吗？ in the user temberature at 2022-06-02T07:14:02
item.description:
in reference to:

这也解释了仿生阅读为什么妨碍了习惯扫读的读者。对于这些人来说，可能整体高亮关键词、或者高亮句首、段首会更有用。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 加粗几个字母之后，英语阅读速度原地起飞，真的这么神奇吗？ in the user temberature at 2022-06-02T07:15:27
item.description:
in reference to:

从这个角度来讲，仿生阅读也未必适用于所有文章。沈阳师范大学曾做过一项文本标注对中文阅读眼动的研究。研究显示，虽然添加高亮会指引和帮助参与者们更好地记忆重点内容、忽略干扰内容，但如果含有错误标识或标识过多，那与无标识的阅读效率几乎是一样的。同时，如果阅读的文本是比较简单的内容，那标示也未必可以提高正确率。

item.description:
in reference to:

Linking makes the thinking process tangible: links are the proofs that you’ve connected the material with your prior knowledge. Having a lot of unlinked notes is also proof that different pieces of information exist in isolation.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated MasterHowToLearn - Why 99% People Never Learned How To Learn And How to Become That 1% (I) in the user temberature at 2022-08-08T11:44:26
item.description:
in reference to:

From now on, my focus on “how to learn” would be shifted from “when should I review this” to “what should I do when I indeed review this?” It’ll be about thinking frameworks and mental models; it’s about “what and how to think” instead of “when to think.”

item.description:
in reference to:

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 游牧教室的文具盒：为何真正的学习是舒适的 in the user temberature at 2022-08-17T03:15:15
item.description:
in reference to:

此时的游牧教室，几乎变成了一层套一层的叠加小宇宙。最内层是学生的头脑。包裹着它的，是我们的对话（以及白板互动）。在这一层对话之外，是我的头脑（其中有无数可能突然才想起来的事例、材料，以及数字卡片资料）。而在我的物质身体之外是书库中无数的书架。

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 教育行业已经没戏了吗？我绝不这么认为 in the user temberature at 2022-08-23T05:56:44
item.description:
in reference to:

反观美国，早在2017年就有90%的中小学实现了iPad辅助教学，纽约等州还推出了"1:1 iPad"（学生人手一台平板）的计划。此外，还有Google Chromebook这个现象级产品，仅仅2020年的发货量就达到了3000万台，其中绝大部分用于教育。在美国，大学生用Macbook、中小学生用Chromebook、大家都用iPad或Surface，早已成为司空见惯的常态。

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated How to extract all highlighted text from a pdf? · Discussion #1573 · pymupdf/PyMuPDF in the user temberature at 2022-08-31T07:08:12
item.description:
in reference to:

The highlighted text is not part of the annotation, but part of the PDF itself, so you have to extract the text located inside the highlight rectangle: text = page.get_textbox(annot.rect).

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated How many words do you need to speak a language? in the user temberature at 2022-09-01T15:14:21
item.description:
in reference to:

If you learn only 800 of the most frequently-used lemmas in English, you'll be able to understand 75% of the language as it is spoken in normal life.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated How many words do you need to speak a language? in the user temberature at 2022-09-01T15:15:11
item.description:
in reference to:

Eight hundred lemmas will help you speak a language in a day-to-day setting, but to understand dialogue in film or TV you'll need to know the 3,000 most common lemmas.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated At What Age Does Our Ability to Learn a New Language Like a Native Speaker Disappear? in the user temberature at 2022-09-02T03:03:33
item.description:
in reference to:

In what could be the most surprising conclusion, the researchers say that even among native speakers it takes 30 years to fully master a language. The study showed a slight improvement—roughly one percentage point—in people who have been speaking English for 30 versus 20 years. The finding is consistent for both native and non-native speakers.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 我是如何艰难地克服「效率成瘾」的？ in the user temberature at 2022-09-02T09:16:14
item.description:
in reference to:

所以说，再举个用好重器 20% 功能的例子，对于 DEVONthink 来说，我觉得它最重要的就是 Search 搜索功能。比如说我通过 Alfred 的 DEVONthink 插件快速输入「重器轻用」，然后我就可以搜到在 DEVONthink 里面所有关于「重器轻用」的信息。而这个搜索速度是极快的，并且在右侧边栏，你可以看到搜索结果有一个展现的区域，让你快速知道哪些地方有相关文字的一个出处。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 我是如何艰难地克服「效率成瘾」的？ in the user temberature at 2022-09-02T09:16:23
item.description:
in reference to:

其实我就能找到之前所有提到该内容的地方，而这个地方的“快”是非常重要的。我常常把 DEVONthink 比作是一栋楼当中的地下室或者是楼阁，当我们需要找什么内容的时候，我们能够非常快速地去找。虽然说平常不会去楼阁里面翻东西，但只要它搜索起来很快，你就能够快速地去找到想要的内容。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 我是如何艰难地克服「效率成瘾」的？ in the user temberature at 2022-09-02T09:16:42
item.description:
in reference to:

就像我今天要分享的内容，其实是在我看一篇文章的时候，快速记录下的跟文章有关的一些想法，而这些灵感会自动通过 Diigo 同步到 DEVONthink 里面。从而当我回顾时，我就可以通过 DEVONthink 重新打开这篇原文查看当时划线的位置。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 我是如何艰难地克服「效率成瘾」的？ in the user temberature at 2022-09-02T09:20:22
item.description:
in reference to:

另外一个机制是 P.A.R.A 中的 Archive，归档这个概念的意义其实也是非常非常重要的。就像我会把所有内容都归档到我的 DEVONthink 里面，我可以看到我所有的推文、所有的笔记，然后也可以看到我所有的网页高亮，还有我发布过的博客或者是 Newsletter 都会归档到我的 DEVONthink 里面。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated DEVONthink 极致搜索体验，搜索属于你自己的本地知识库（电子书、阅读高亮、笔记思考、Twitter推文、博客输出）_哔哩哔哩_bilibili in the user temberature at 2022-09-02T09:22:26
item.description:
in reference to:

DT最吸引我的是支持文档的全文的秒级搜索（当然能支持正则那就更棒了），

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated Folder Structure to Maximize Writing with Devonthink Pro — Workflows in Personal and Professional Productivity in the user temberature at 2022-09-03T14:29:11
item.description:
in reference to:

Although at one point I had all my information on manuscripts in a single DTP database, over the last year I have maintained separate databases; one for PDFs, another for my annotations.I accomplish this by having separate folders in Dropbox. After extracting my annotations from Highlights.app, I place the exported files in their own folder. Once a month, I export all the PDFs in my Paper’s Library to their own Dropbox folder. I use a Hazel script to throw away any duplicate PDFs in the Dropbox folder. I index (not import) the annotations folder into one DTP database, and index my PDFs into another.

temberature@hypothes.is said:
